help.name: search Collection
help.command: search collection '<collection Name or key>' for '<string>' using ( [ page_size=<int> edit_distance=<integer> display_first=<integer>]) show (data|docs) [ estimate only|return as data|save as '<csv_filename>' ]
help.description:
Performs a document search of the Deep Search repository based on a given Collection. A collection must be specified in the using clause. Use Estimate only, if you are doing a general search, so as to determine the potential number of hits.

Parameters:
<cmd>system_id</cmd> - (default: default) system cluster id.
<cmd>page_size</cmd> - (default: None) Paginate the results.
<cmd>edit_distance</cmd> (default: 10) - Set the search criteria for key words for document searches. When set to 0, no snippets will be be returned.
<cmd>display_first</cmd> (default: 0) if display first > 0 the displayed result set will truncated at the given number.

Clauses:
<cmd>show (data)</cmd> - Display structured data from within the documents.
<cmd>show (docs)</cmd> - Display document context.
<cmd>estimate only</cmd> - Determine the potential number of hits.
<cmd>return as data</cmd> - For Notebook or API mode. Removes all styling from the Pandas DataFrame, ready for further processing.

Examples:
- Look for documents that contain discussions on power conversion efficiency:

    <cmd>search collection 'arxiv-abstract' for 'ide("power conversion efficiency" OR PCE) AND organ*' using ( edit_distance=20 system_id=default) show (docs)</cmd>

- Search the pubchem archive for 'Ibuprofen' and display related molecules' data:

    <cmd>search collection 'pubchem' for 'Ibuprofen'  show (data)</cmd>

- Search for patents which mention a specific smiles molecule:

    <cmd>search collection 'uspto-patent' for 'identifiers._name:"smiles#ccc(coc(=o)cs)(c(=o)c(=o)cs)c(=o)c(=o)cs"'  show (data)</cmd>
